verses.text: And thou shalt make an altar to burn incense upon: \add of\add* shittim wood shalt thou make it.

A cubit \add shall be\add* the length thereof, and a cubit the breadth thereof; foursquare shall it be: and two cubits \add shall be\add* the height thereof: the horns thereof \add shall be\add* of the same.
And thou shalt overlay it with pure gold, the top thereof, and the sides thereof round about, and the horns thereof; and thou shalt make unto it a crown \add of\add* gold round about.

And two golden rings shalt thou make to it under the crown of it, by the two corners thereof, upon the two sides of it shalt thou make \add it;\add* and they shall be for places for the staves to bear it withal.
And thou shalt make the staves \add of\add* shittim wood, and overlay them with gold.
And thou shalt put it before the vail that \add is\add* by the ark of the Testimony, before the mercy seat that \add is\add* over the Testimony, where I will meet with thee.
And Aaron shall burn thereon sweet incense every morning: when he dresseth the lamps, he shall burn incense upon it.
And when Aaron lighteth the lamps at even, he shall burn incense upon it, a perpetual incense before the \sc Lord\sc* throughout your generations.
Ye shall offer no strange incense thereon, nor burnt sacrifice, nor meat offering; neither shall ye pour drink offering thereon.

And Aaron shall make an atonement upon the horns of it once in a year with the blood of the sin offering of atonements: once in the year shall he make atonement upon it throughout your generations: it \add is\add* most holy unto the \sc Lord\sc*.
And the \sc Lord\sc* spake unto Moses, saying,

When thou takest the sum of the children of Israel after their number, then shall they give every man a ransom for his soul unto the \sc Lord\sc*, when \add thou\add* numberest them; that there be no plague amongst them, when \add thou\add* numberest them.

This they shall give, every one that passeth among them that are numbered, half a shekel after the shekel of the sanctuary: (a shekel \add is\add* twenty gerahs:) a half shekel \add shall be\add* the offering of the \sc Lord\sc*.
Every one that passeth among them that are numbered, from twenty years old and above, shall give an offering unto the \sc Lord\sc*.
The rich shall not give more, and the poor shall not give less than half a shekel, when \add they\add* give an offering unto the \sc Lord\sc*, to make an atonement for your souls.

And thou shalt take the atonement money of the children of Israel, and shalt appoint it for the service of the tabernacle of the congregation; that it may be a memorial unto the children of Israel before the \sc Lord\sc*, to make an atonement for your souls.
And the \sc Lord\sc* spake unto Moses, saying,

Thou shalt also make a laver \add of\add* brass, and his foot \add also of\add* brass, to wash \add withal:\add* and thou shalt put it between the tabernacle of the congregation and the altar, and thou shalt put water therein.
For Aaron and his sons shall wash their hands and their feet thereat:

when they go into the tabernacle of the congregation, they shall wash \add with\add* water, that they die not; or when they come near to the altar to minister, to burn offering made by fire unto the \sc Lord\sc*:
so they shall wash their hands and their feet, that they die not: and it shall be a statute for ever to them, \add even\add* to him and to his seed throughout their generations.
Moreover the \sc Lord\sc* spake unto Moses, saying,

Take thou also unto thee principal spices, of pure myrrh five hundred \add shekels\add*, and of sweet cinnamon half so much, \add even\add* two hundred and fifty \add shekels\add*, and of sweet calamus two hundred and fifty \add shekels\add*,
and of cassia five hundred \add shekels\add*, after the shekel of the sanctuary, and of oil olive a hin:
and thou shalt make it an oil of holy ointment, an ointment compound \add after\add* the art of the apothecary: it shall be a holy anointing oil.
And thou shalt anoint the tabernacle of the congregation therewith, and the ark of the Testimony,
and the table and all his vessels, and the candlestick and his vessels, and the altar of incense,
and the altar of burnt offering with all his vessels, and the laver and his foot.
And thou shalt sanctify them, that they may be most holy: whatsoever toucheth them shall be holy.
And thou shalt anoint Aaron and his sons, and consecrate them, that \add they\add* may minister unto me in the priest’s office.
And thou shalt speak unto the children of Israel, saying, This shall be a holy anointing oil unto me throughout your generations.
Upon man’s flesh shall it not be poured, neither shall ye make \add any other\add* like it, after the composition of it: it \add is\add* holy, \add and\add* it shall be holy unto you.
Whosoever compoundeth \add any\add* like it, or whosoever putteth \add any\add* of it upon a stranger, shall even be cut off from his people.

And the \sc Lord\sc* said unto Moses, Take unto thee sweet spices, stacte, and onycha, and galbanum; \add these\add* sweet spices with pure frankincense: of each shall there be a like \add weight:\add*
and thou shalt make it a perfume, a confection \add after\add* the art of the apothecary, tempered together, pure \add and\add* holy:
and thou shalt beat \add some\add* of it very small, and put of it before the Testimony in the tabernacle of the congregation, where I will meet with thee: it shall be unto you most holy.
And \add as for\add* the perfume which thou shalt make, you shall not make to yourselves according to the composition thereof: it shall be unto thee holy for the \sc Lord\sc*.
Whosoever shall make like unto that, to smell thereto, shall even be cut off from his people.
